law.catch_line: This section applies to any person:...

text.section:
This section applies to any person:
constructing a generating station and its associated overhead transmission lines designed to carry a voltage in excess of 69,000 volts; or
exercising the right of condemnation in connection with the construction.

section.section: To obtain the certificate of public convenience and necessity required under § 7-207 of this subtitle for construction under this section, a person shall file an application with the Commission at least 2 years before construction of the facility will commence.
The Commission may waive the 2-year requirement on a showing of good cause.

text.section:
The applicant shall:
include in an application under this section the information that the Commission requests initially; and
furnish any additional information that the Commission requests subsequently.

section.section:
The Commission shall hold a public hearing on the application as required by § 7-207 of this subtitle, after:
the receipt of any additional information requested under subsection (c)(2) of this section that the Commission considers necessary; and
any publication of notice the Commission considers to be proper.

At the public hearing, the Commission shall ensure presentation of the information and recommendations of the State units specified in paragraph (1) of this subsection and shall allow the official representative of each unit to sit during hearing of all parties.
Based on the evidence relating to the unit's areas of concern, the Commission shall allow each unit 15 days after the conclusion of the hearing to modify or affirm the unit's initial recommendations.

text.section:
Within 90 days after the conclusion of the hearing on an application under this section, the Commission shall:
grant a certificate of public convenience and necessity unconditionally;
grant the certificate, subject to conditions the Commission determines to be appropriate; or
deny the certificate; and
notify all interested parties of its decision.

section.section:
The Commission shall include in each certificate it issues under subsection (e) of this section:
the requirements of the federal and State environmental laws and standards that are identified by the Department of the Environment; and
the methods and conditions that the Commission determines are appropriate to comply with those environmental laws and standards.

The Commission may not adopt any method or condition under paragraph (1)(ii) of this subsection that the Department of the Environment determines is inconsistent with federal and State environmental laws and standards.
A decision of the Commission regarding the issuance of a certificate requires the vote of a majority of the members of the Commission.
If a majority of the members of the Commission fails to reach agreement on the conditions to be attached to a conditional certificate, the certificate shall be denied.

text.section:
The grant of a certificate by the Commission to any person under subsection (e) of this section constitutes:
authority for the person to dredge and construct bulkheads in the waters or private wetlands of the State and to appropriate or use the waters; and
registration and a permit to construct, as required under Title 2, Subtitle 4 of the Environment Article.
